title: Can someone publish a book with only 5 pages? - Quora

response.answer_text: Okay, technically, you cannot self-publish (which is the only way a “5-page book” could get published) a 5-page print book. The minimum page count for KDP Print (Amazon) is 24 pages, and for IngramSpark is 18 pages. You certainly could self-publish a 5-page eBook, but why would you? Also technically, 5 pages does not a book make. Here are some parameters for you: Short-short stories are under 2,500 words.Short stories can range from 2,500 to 7,500 words.Novellettes are from 7,500 to 20,000 words.Novellas are from 20,000 to 50,000 words.Novels are from 70,000 to 90,000 words.The above is according to: Word Count and Story Length on BetterStoryTelling.net. This range varies greatly depending on the source. But none of them are 5 pages. WritersDigest states: “There are general guidelines for each literary category: Short stories range anywhere from 1,500 to 30,000 words; Novellas run from 30,000 to 50,000; Novels range from 55,000 to 300,000 words, but I wouldn’t recommend aiming for the high end, as books the length of War & Peace aren’t exactly the easiest to sell.” Then you have flash fiction which can run from around 100 words up to about 500 or 1,000. Fewer words than that is considered micro-fiction. Notice the word BOOK is nowhere in there. You can find flash fiction collections for sale which contain dozens of stories and are most likely at least 50 pages in length. But how does knowing word count help you? Some people suggest that to figure out a page count based on word count, the industry standard is 250 words per page. That most likely refers to manuscript pages, not book pages. To determine those, you’d need to know what size print book you’ll be creating. To calculate the page count for a 5″ × 8″ book: 10 pt type – divide your word count by 40011 pt type – divide your word count by 35012 pt type – divide your word count by 300More information is provided in this article: Calculate book page count using word count - for book design If you have a 5-page story you would like to get out there, I suggest publishing it to a site like Medium or Wattpad or even Quora. Maybe you’ll get feedback that will inspire you to write more, and you can publish something with more meat to it. Good luck!

You can try to publish a 5-page book, but first you have to get through the hurdle of printing. You cannot print a 5-page book. The inside pages must be a minimum 4 pages, and then the next up is 8 pages. Then there’s the 4 faces for the covers (outside front, inside front, inside back, and outside back). If you’re okay with 3 blank pages, then you’ll be fine. If not, you’re going to have an almighty argument with your printer — and you won’t win. After going through that hurdle, then you can properly publish the thing. And hopefully the content will be earth-shatteringly phenomenal to land the sales.

Your best bet would be to self publish the book on Amazon. However, a few words of wisdom: Even if you describe the story as “short” “very short” “5 pages” - readers will get annoyed. I’ve offered freebie 5–10 page shorts before and even though I say THIS IS 5 PAGES all over the place, they still get angry.You will likely need to offer it for free, because 99 cents is more common for longer works now.My advice - do a collection of various short stories and publish that, rather than one 5-page work.

Yes you can publish a 5 page book. Your readers will probably feel cheated unless you give it away free though - even if ‘short’ is part of the title. I know of a book consisting of 200 blank pages and another featuring a single picture of a foot.
Technically, yes you could. Amazon has a category called 15-Minutes Reads for very short works. But, if I were you I would try to get the word count up a little.
It would be a pamphlet, not a book.
That’s a pamphlet. No one will buy a 5 page pamphlet.
